shortdesc.ph: Sets the audio data format for in-ear monitoring.
Sets the audio data format for in-ear monitoring.
Sets the data format for the callback.
Sets the data format for the callback.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setEarMonitoringAudioFrameParameters( {required int sampleRate, required int channel, required RawAudioFrameOpModeType mode, required int samplesPerCall});
public abstract int SetEarMonitoringAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall);

section.p: This method sets the audio data format for the callback.
This method sets the audio data format for the callback.
This method sets the data format for the callback.
This method sets the data format for the callback.

ul.li: Before calling this method, you need to call and set includeAudioFilters to EarMonitoringFilterBuiltInAudioFilters or EarMonitoringFilterNoiseSuppression.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is not less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.
Before calling this method, you need to call and set includeAudioFilters to EarMonitoringFilterBuiltInAudioFilters or EarMonitoringFilterNoiseSuppression.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.
Before calling this method, you need to call and set includeAudioFilters to earMonitoringFilterBuiltInAudioFilters or earMonitoringFilterNoiseSuppression.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.
Before calling this method, you need to call and set includeAudioFilters to EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_BUILT_IN_AUDIO_FILTERS or EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_NOISE_SUPPRESSION.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval using the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters in this method. The formula is: sampling interval = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the sampling interval is no less than 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.

plentry.pd: Sampling rate (Hz) of the audio reported in . Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

Number of audio channels reported in . Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Usage mode of the audio frame. See .
Number of audio samples reported in , typically 1024 in scenarios like CDN streaming.
The sample rate (Hz) of the audio reported in , can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels reported in , can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The usage mode of the audio frame. See .
The number of audio samples reported in , typically 1024 in scenarios like CDN streaming.
Sampling rate (Hz) of the audio reported in , can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

Number of audio channels reported in , can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Usage mode of the audio frame. See .
Number of audio samples reported in , typically 1024 in applications like push streaming.
The sampling rate (Hz) of the audio reported in . Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of channels of the audio reported in . Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The operation mode of the audio frame. See .
The number of audio samples reported in , typically 1024 in RTMP streaming scenarios.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggested solutions.
